definition: to make an effort/to push for sth/to work hard
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
to exert oneself (bound form)
to make an effort to become strong (idiom); determined to do better/to pull one's socks up
to prove one's worth through firm resolve (idiom)

sentences.english: You think it was the resolution of Goujian, the Yue king?
sentences.chinese: 你認爲是越王勾踐臥薪嚐膽發奮勵志？

sentences.english: Nation-building needs talent, worked hard and is ambitious.
sentences.chinese: 國家建設需人才，發奮圖強宏圖現。

sentences.english: Less swim unwilling humiliation was younger sister, have vowed to take on their own hard.
sentences.chinese: 少遊不甘被小妹屈辱，誓言會靠自己發奮。

sentences.english: He tries to get the iphone well over the shelf.
sentences.chinese: 他發奮去夠架子上的蘋果，但是沒能夠到。

sentences.english: Achievers are good at motivating others.
sentences.chinese: 善於激勵別人發奮圖強。

sentences.english: Life is a great big canvas, and you should throw all the paint on it you can.
sentences.chinese: 人生是一幅大畫布，你就應發奮繪出絢麗多彩的畫面。

sentences.english: In the world, a man who would make his way, must plague and bestir himself night and day.
sentences.chinese: 要在人世間成功進取，須日日夜夜發奮磨練。

sentences.english: Hard work is often a ladder to success.
sentences.chinese: 發奮工作常是通向成功的階梯。

sentences.english: We promised to meet in the United States. So we both worked hard at our lessons.
sentences.chinese: 我們曾相約在美國相見，因此我們都在發奮讀書。

sentences.english: Always work hard on something uncomfortably exciting!
sentences.chinese: 那就是在那些讓人極度興奮的事情上發奮努力。

definition: to endure humiliation as part of an important mission (idiom); to suffer in silence
to bury oneself in work (idiom); to be engrossed in work/to make an all-out effort/up to the neck in work
unyielding/indomitable
persevering
to have a sense of shame
lit. to return to office after living as a hermit on Mount Dongshan (idiom); fig. to make a comeback
to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom)/to skip one's sleep and meals/to be completely wrapped up in one's work
a great number of students (idiom)
cautious and conscientious
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
to advance by leaps and bounds
dangerous and difficult (path)
hardworking/diligent
hardships/arduous/difficult
to guide patiently and systematically (idiom)
to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost
